unnormalised: Guys, remember to file your Income Tax Returns (ITR) before the due date, which is usually July 31st. For FY 2023-24 (Assessment Year 2024-25), failing to file by the deadline could mean a late fee of up to Rs. 5,000 u/s 234F. Also, don't forget to declare all your income sources, including interest earned on savings accounts like SBI and investments like PPF. You can file your ITR online through the e-filing portal of the Income Tax Department. Consult a CA if needed!
normalised: Guys, remember to file your Income Tax Returns (I-T-R) before the due date, which is usually July thirty first. For F-Y two thousand twenty three two thousand twenty four (Assessment Year two thousand twenty four two thousand twenty five), failing to file by the deadline could mean a late fee of up to rupee five thousand under section two hundred thirty four F. Also, don't forget to declare all your income sources, including interest earned on savings accounts like S-B-I and investments like P-P-F. You can file your I-T-R online through the e-filing portal of the Income Tax Department. Consult a C-A if needed!
